title: Asian stocks advance at open, gold tops $4,500
summary: Asian stocks opened higher, following Wall Street's record rally fueled by robust US economic growth data. Gold, silver, and copper prices surged to new highs, while oil extended its gains amid geopolitical tensions. Despite strong US growth, bets on near-term Federal Reserve easing were scaled back as risk appetite remained firm heading into year-end.

title: PNB Housing bounces back after CEO shock—growth and asset quality in focus
summary: After an 18% stock drop following the sudden CEO exit, PNB Housing has regained investor confidence with stronger asset quality and steady growth, but rising risks in the affordable housing segment could test the recovery.

title: Penny stock under  ₹5: Steel stock jumps up to 14% after product launch; profit margin to benefit 20%
summary: Penny stock under  ₹5: In an exchange filing, Ganga Forging announced that the company has entered into the Elastic Rail Clip segment, a critical railway track fastening component used by Indian Railways.

title: Small cap stock Vikran Engineering jumps over 15% in biggest 1-day spike since listing on  ₹2,035 crore order win
summary: Vikran Engineering's share price surged 15.40% to  ₹100 after securing a  ₹2,035.26 crore order for solar projects in Maharashtra. This order represents 95% of the company's market cap and enhances its renewable energy portfolio, reflecting strong momentum in their EPC business.

title: Stage collapses to flight delays: Why wedding insurance remains a hard sell
summary: India will host weddings worth  ₹6.5 trillion this year, yet few couples insure them. High costs, rare mishaps, and confusing exclusions keep wedding insurance on the sidelines.

title: Nuvama initiates coverage on Ashish Kacholia-backed stock with Rs 2,500 target, cites 3 bullish triggers
summary: Nuvama Institutional Equities has initiated coverage on Knowledge Marine & Engineering Works with a ‘Buy’ rating and a target price of Rs 2,500, citing strong maritime sector tailwinds, a robust order book, superior margins, and execution strength across geographies. The brokerage expects sharp growth in revenue and profitability through FY28, supported by government-led infrastructure spending and green tug opportunities.

title: Manappuram, Muthoot Finance shares rally up to 7% to fresh peaks. What's pushing the gold lenders higher?
summary: Shares of Manappuram Finance and Muthoot Finance hit record highs on the BSE as domestic and global gold prices touched fresh peaks. Rising bullion prices, strong gold loan demand, and favourable brokerage outlooks have driven sharp gains in gold-backed lenders, significantly outperforming the broader market in 2025.

title: Christmas Stock Market Holiday: Is stock market open tomorrow? Check NSE, BSE December 2025 holiday list
summary: NSE Holidays 2025: Leading exchanges NSE and BSE will remain closed for trading on Thursday, December 25, due to the Christmas holiday. The commodity exchanges MCX and NCDEX will also take a day’s break and resume trading on Friday.

title: Forget the Nifty, look at these 50. If they make a comeback in 2026, then it is probably a bull market
summary: From being a set of stocks that had beaten the Nifty on all counts between 2021 and 2024, these stocks have been under pressure for the whole of 2025. But even though they have been under pressure as a set, 27 have delivered positive returns as compared to the same date last year; and only 23 are in the red. More than that, this set of stocks is suited both for investors and traders. Why? Because of the fact that most investors tend to trade with a bullish bias. So, as stocks where probability favours the bulls, it will be good to have them on your watchlist.

title: Top Gainers & losers on Dec 24: Hindustan Copper, Hindustan Zinc, Bharat Dynamics, Trent, Castrol among top gainers
summary: Indian stock market faced mild losses on December 24, driven by declines in IT stocks and low trading volumes. Nifty 50 fell 0.14% to 26,140, while Sensex dropped 0.16% to 85,388. Media and chemical sectors showed some gains amidst overall weak sentiment.

title: Sensex drops over 100 points, Nifty 50 ends below 26,150— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
summary: The Sensex dropped 116 points, or 0.14%, to close at 85,408.70, while the Nifty 50 settled at 26,142.10, down 35 points, or 0.13%.

title: Missed out on gold, silver price rally? This metal can be a lucrative alternative
summary: Copper prices have hit unprecedented highs above $12,000 a ton in the global market on fears over a tighter global market in 2026. Prices on the London Metal Exchange are now on track for an annual gain of about 40%, the biggest since 2009.

title: HDFC Securities allows gold ETF buying with 70% margin at 1% monthly interest
summary: You can now buy gold ETFs with 70% borrowed money from HDFC Securities at 1% interest per month

title: Air India bummer: After end to non-stop flights between Bengaluru and San Francisco, what options do passengers have?
summary: The Bengaluru-San Francisco route is a hit among IT professionals and VFR traffic (Visiting Friends and Relatives) since old parents visiting families in the Bay Area can effortlessly fly without transferring at major hubs in Europe, which is the other way of reaching San Francisco.

title: Bharti, Warburg Pincus to acquire 49% stake in Haier India to boost local manufacturing capacity — Details here
summary: Haier India Stake Deal: Bharti Enterprises and Warburg Pincus, on 24 December 2025, announced that the companies have decided to acquire a 49% stake in Haier India. The acquirers aim to boost local manufacturing capacity and infuse fresh capital into the business.&nbsp;

title: When buying insurance, why honesty is the best policy for claims and coverage
summary: Concealing health details may help secure a policy, but it can derail claims later. Why full disclosure—not approval—is the real test of a successful health insurance plan.

title: Tax benefits on loans explained: Home, education, vehicle and personal loans
summary: The article highlights tax benefits for various loans, focusing on home loans, education loans, vehicle loans, and personal loans.&nbsp;

title: Market Wrap: Sensex down 116 pts, Nifty below 26,150 as foreign outflows drag
summary: Indian equities ended lower on Wednesday as thin, pre-holiday trade and foreign investor selling kept sentiment muted. Sensex and Nifty slipped marginally, dragged by oil & gas, pharma and IT stocks. Market activity remained subdued ahead of the Christmas break, mirroring low volumes across global markets.

title: FIIs turn net buyers of Indian stocks in a week, lap up stocks worth  ₹1,350 crore. What's the reason? Explained
summary: FIIs have been net sellers of Indian stocks to the tune of over  ₹155,000 crore in 2025 so far, largely plagued by a weak Indian rupee, steep 50% tariffs on India by the US President Donald Trump and high valuations and slowdown in earnings.

title: Dollar set for worst year since 2017, yen still in focus
summary: GLOBAL-FOREX/ (UPDATE 1):FOREX-Dollar set for worst year since 2017, yen still in focus

title: Who needs to file revised ITR after Income Tax Department's message?
summary: The Income Tax Department has alerted many taxpayers that their refunds are on hold due to ITR mismatches. The identified taxpayers must file revised returns by 31 December 2025, or face additional tax liabilities.&nbsp;

title: Not skill or qualifications: Gurmeet Chadha says financial freedom came down to his digestive ability
summary: Market expert Gurmeet Chadha says his journey to financial independence was shaped not by skill or qualifications but by the ability to endure stock market volatility. Emphasising long-term investing and patience, he believes surviving market cycles and trusting India’s growth story are key to building wealth.

title: Stock Radar: APL Apollo Tubes stock forms VCP pattern; consolidates around long-term averages; check target & stop loss
summary: APL Apollo Tubes has broken out of a two-month consolidation after forming a bullish VCP pattern, signalling renewed buying interest. Trading above key EMAs with strong volumes, the stock shows trend strength, though RSI indicates a short-term pause. Analysts expect a move toward Rs 2,100, with dips offering entry opportunities.

title: Gainers & Losers: Groww, Kajaria Ceramics and 4 more stocks in focus on Wednesday
summary: Key stocks in focus on Wednesday included Manappuram, Hindustan Copper, Groww, Websol Energy, IndiGo and Kajaria Ceramics as markets paused their recent winning streak.

title: India bonds swing to biggest gains since May after RBI announces cash infusion
summary: The benchmark 10-year yield ended at 6.5398%, after closing at 6.6328% on Tuesday, dropping the most in a single ⁠session since May 13. Bond ⁠yields move inversely to prices.

title: M&M announces board meeting date to consider Q3 results. Check details here
summary: Investors will be closely tracking M&amp;M and other auto players’ third-quarter earnings, as Q3 will be the first full quarter to reflect the impact of the goods and services tax (GST) cut implemented by the government at the end of September 2025.

title: Largecaps make a strong comeback in 2025: 6 stocks soar over 50%
summary: Largecap stocks staged a strong comeback in 2025 after two years of lagging midcaps and smallcaps. One-third of largecaps gained over 20%, with six soaring more than 50%. Technical indicators signal institutional buying and sustained momentum, suggesting largecaps may continue to lead heading into 2026.

title: Vedanta, Shriram Finance among 7 largecap stocks hit 52-week highs; gains of up to 35% in a month
summary: Seven large-cap stocks, including Vedanta, Shriram Finance, Hindustan Zinc and Hindalco, hit fresh 52-week highs on Wednesday despite a weak broader market.

title: TCS to declare Q3 results 2025, interim dividend on this date. Check details
summary: TCS's board will meet on January 12, 2026, to approve Q3FY26 financial results and discuss a third interim dividend. The record date for dividend eligibility is January 17, 2026.

title: Gujarat Kidney IPO booked 5.2x on final day; retail investors show strong interest, GMP indicates muted listing
summary: Gujarat Kidney IPO attracted strong investor interest, with a subscription rate of 5.21 times. Retail investors led with a 19 times subscription. The IPO, worth  ₹250.80 crore, aims to fund acquisitions and capital expenditure. Shares are set to list on NSE and BSE on December 30.
